questions.question: Why was it important for Tree-ear to know about weddings, births and deaths?

choices.answer: He could make pottery to celebrate those events.
He liked to know about all the events in town.
All of those events usually had left-over food.
He would know what dates to write on his calendar

questions.question: How was Tree-ear able to fill the pouch he wore at his waist?

choices.answer: He picked out all the paper in the trash can.
He picked up the rice that the farmer dropped.
He picked up all the shells he found at the beach.
He picked up all the pebbles he found on the road.

questions.question: How did Crane-man get his name?

choices.answer: He was born with one leg and they said he was like a crane.
His parents liked looking at cranes.
He had a deep interest in studying all about cranes.
He liked the word 'crane,' because it rhymed with 'lane.

questions.question: Why did Tree-ear enjoy watching Min?

choices.answer: Min taught Tree-ear about pottery while he used the wheel.
Min made pottery making appear very easy.
Min was an expert at shaping pottery on the wheel
Min's pottery was the finest in the whole country.

questions.question: How do you know the farmer is impatient?

choices.answer: He would yell people around him if they made a mistake.
He wouldn't wait for his pack to be woven with a double wall
He never wanted to wait in line for anything.
He was always in a hurry to do things.

questions.question: What was Tree-ear thinking when he decided to bring his own bowl to Min's house?

choices.answer: Tree-ear knew that he couldn't break his plastic bowl.
Tree-ear wanted Min to show him how to make a bowl.
He wanted to show Min the size of the bowl he wanted to make
He wanted to eat half and give the rest to Crane-man.

questions.question: Why did Min destroy all his vases?

choices.answer: Every vase had glaze that was flawed.
Min was angry and destroyed all his vases.
Min decided he didn't want to make vases anymore.
Min was disappointed with all his vases.

questions.question: Why did Tree-ear feel he was a failure?

choices.answer: Min reluctantly allowed Tree-ear to take the vases to Songdo
Min didn't provideTree-ear with provisions for his journey.
Min treated Tree-ear as if he were a young child
Robbers stole Min's vases and threw them over a cliff.

questions.question: How did Min honor Tree-ear?

choices.answer: How did Min honor Tree-ear?
Min gave Tree-ear a raise in salary for all his hard work.
Gave Tree-ear his son's name and asked him to live with them
Min gave Tree-ear his own bedroom

questions.question: What did Tree-ear offer to do for Min?

choices.answer: Tree-ear offered to check all the glazes.
Tree-ear offered to clean the pottery wheel.
Tree-ear offered to fire all of Min's pottery in the kiln.
Tree-ear offered to deliver Min's prize vessel to Songdo.

questions.question: What advice did Crane-man give Tree-ear as he was to leave for Songdo?

choices.answer: Crane-man told Tree-ear to make sure to eat.
Crane-man told Tree-ear not to talk to strangers.
He told him people may be his greatest danger....
He told him to get rest as to not get tired on his journey.

questions.question: Why did Tree-ear work for Min?

choices.answer: Min was paying Tree-ear a good salary for working.
Tree-ear wanted to learn about making pottery.
Min caught Tree-ear stealing, working for Min was punishment
Tree-ear was taking a pottery class and Min was his teacher

questions.question: How does a potter plan so that one of his pieces would fire to an unflawed celadon green?

choices.answer: Potter arranges that the kiln will fire one piece at a time
He prepares many identical pieces hopes one will be unflawed
Potter makes many green glazes and hopes one is perfect
Potter looks at the green glaze under a microscope .....

questions.question: Why was Kang pleased when he heard a royal emissary would be visiting Chu'l'po and Kangjin?

choices.answer: The emissary was on a tour to assign commissions for palace
There was a grand party for the emissary; Kang was invited.
Kang would have his picture taken with the royal emissary
Kang would be able to have lunch with the royal emissary.

questions.question: Why was Tree-ear filled with mixed emotion after returning from Songdo?

choices.answer: He was scared carrying the vases, he couldn't tell Min
He wished he could take Crane-man on the journey to Songdo
Crane-man died while he was getting the commission
He didn't want Min to know he'd never traveled before

questions.question: Why did Crane-man break his crutch?

choices.answer: He broke it on a rock, he was mad about not getting any fish
He broke it on a car because he was mad about a flat tire
He broke it on a building because he lost money
He broke it on a tree because he was having a bad golf game

questions.question: Why did Min refuse to teach Tree-ear to make a pot?

choices.answer: Potters only teach their trade to their sons
Min was afraid Tree-ear would be a better potter than him
Min didn't have enough patience to teach him
Min didn't want Tree-ear to know his secrets

questions.question: Why did Tree-ear cry when Min's wife asked Tree-ear to call her Ajima?

choices.answer: Tree-ear realized that Min's wife like him.
Tree-ear realized that Mins family cared about him
Ajima is a term of great affection reserved older kinswomen
Tree-ear finally felt accepted by his family

questions.question: When did Tree-ear get the feeling that nothing could go wrong in the world?

choices.answer: when he looked up at the sky and saw beautiful clouds

When he saw a prunus vase with a branch of flowering plum

choices.answer: Under the highway

He desired a royal commission and then wanted to retire

He never went back to Min and started a life elsewhere

He wanted to ask Min if he could have a vacation

choices.answer: Pottery has dried in the sun and looks like leather

The pottery is the color of brown
